programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders head to Hollywood, where they try to make a profit by selling a set of vintage Masonic swords, a polygraph machine and a Second World War samurai blade.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Despite the crew's best efforts, a devastated Martin aborts the expedition when a power failure hits the ship and Mark's life is at risk.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A team risks hunting during an electrical storm, while other swampers are forced into dangerous territory.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The rescue teams have their work cut out when pipe trucks roll over in both Alberta and British Columbia, while Al deals with a problem involving multiple bottles of red hot sauce.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: There are fierce negotiations for an American Civil War musket and Corey feels the brunt of his father's anger when he sells a rare poster from his movie collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The search for an alleged UFO thought to have crashed in Aurora, Texas in 1897. Locals claimed they buried the craft and its alien pilot, so investigators dig for evidence of the claim.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge a fully functional serrated knife using steel from hand scissors, or risk getting cut from the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy unleashes a series of pranks on the buyers at an auction in Toronto. Meanwhile, Paul promises to teach Bogart about marriage.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: The buyers head to an auction in the Bridle Path area of Toronto, and Roy makes big plans for the stag party he is arranging for Bogart.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a racing driver and inspect his collection of motoring memorabilia, and also gamble on buying some vintage pilots equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz locate a 1947 Harley-Davidson Knucklehead, and are given VIP access to the untouched stash of a former antiques shop owner.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a battered Evel Knievel pinball machine, a collection of antique glass eyes, and a signed photograph of baseball player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team ponders whether to buy a watch formerly owned by convicted fraudster Bernie Madoff, and also considers a 1950s bowling game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cheerleader visits the shop to pawn her ring from the 1989 Super Bowl, and there is a chance to buy a motor home.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers consider buying a straitjacket that belonged to Harry Houdini, a letter from activist Helen Keller and a loudspeaker from the Brooklyn Dodgers' stadium.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over top-secret wartime documents, while Corey tries to get a good price for a toy from the 1970s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop owners value a Cold War era heat-seeking missile guidance system, deliberate over a Playboy bunny uniform, and check out a 1986 Buick Regal motor car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys get a taste of the Wild West when they value a 19th-century revolver. They also examine a set of Elvis Presley's medical records.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect a document signed by one of America's founding fathers and a Rickenbacker electric guitar from the 1930s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a cavalry jacket from the American Civil War, and a book signed by vaudeville performer and silent-film star Will Rogers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a wanted poster of John Wilkes Booth, the actor who assassinated Abraham Lincoln.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian attends an auction which is selling fittings from the 1914 cruise ship Brittanic, sister ship to the Titanic. At Castle Ellen, a stately home near Athenry in County Galway, he works hard to prize away objects from profuse collector Michael Keaney..

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The programme contemplates the possibility of the first astronauts reaching Mars in the next 20 years, and wonders if there is evidence to suggest human life was first seeded there.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists who suggest that aliens have been guiding mankind in secret to bring about huge leaps in technological advancement.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: With previous dives ending in failure, Martin's son Grant offers up an alternative strategy to recover the treasure of the Republic.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: Prince Louis' dark secret is discovered by Margaret. King Philip prepares his army for war, and Landry reunites with his daughter. Historical drama, starring Tom Cullen.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Following a rocky start, Chase attempts to redeem himself and get back into dad's good graces, while Daniel sets a catch quota for his family to hit to stay on track.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz April 2016, with comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Eddie Izzard joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at that week's news stories.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Nikki Fox, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Joe Lycett to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A prankster boyfriend whose jokes have gone too far with his girlfriend arrives in court. Plus, a car seller and his friend's stupidity has landed him in front of the judge.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: In the final episode, a man's stag dos have come between him and his fiancee, and an amateur burlesque group come to the court for compensation.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Herman gives The Jug And The Other Jug a relaunch. Meanwhile, the deadly disease Woodpox is sweeping through Munty, and only Howell has the cure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motor racing driver Lewis Hamilton demonstrates his abilities on the test track, and Richard Hammond tries his hand in a Formula One car. Jeremy Clarkson and James May assess historic vehicles to establish which one pioneered the control layout used in modern cars, and singer-songwriter James Blunt is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: Rick's barge trip brings him to Castelnaudary, where he visits the canteen of the French Foreign Legion, prepares a spicy tagine with couscous and enjoys a three-course lunch consisting of roast leg of veal with potato gratin dauphinioise, goats' cheese and strawberries.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food starts to smell the salty Mediterranean sea on the warm breeze and serves freshly grilled sardines with salad and cold rose wine for the boat crew as they reach Narbonne. Meanwhile, Louis, the chef onboard Anjodi, rustles up seafood with squid ink pasta.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage from Barcelona of an event where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than Â£1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Relive the Top Gear team's attempts to constructing a V8-powered rocking chair, building Top Gear's own electric car, and making the world's first caravan-based train..

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Highlights include creating stretch limos based on European cars, giving a Mercedes S Class a country cottage style make-over, and Jeremy Clarkson making a public information film..

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets off on a high-altitude trek from Kathmandu, capital of Nepal, to the Forbidden City of Lo Manthang, a secretive kingdom perched high on the Tibetan plateau, on the far side of the Himalayas. On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. They're crossing the Himalayas in a small old Peugeot, a very compact old Renault, and Nepal's first (and only) home-built car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Denise Lewis, Richard Osman, Robert Rinder and Katherine Ryan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee manages to persuade Lucy to spend a long weekend on his dad's new boat, despite her inability to swim and lifelong fear of water. However, the vessel turns out to be not quite the sleek yacht they were expecting. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Bobby Ball and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee wants to create the perfect Christmas for Lucy, so he invites her to spend the holiday in a cosy old country house that used to belong to his dear, dead old aunt - and to make it a proper family get-together, he invites along her parents and dipsy friend Daisy. But the Christmas spirit is in short supply when Lucy discovers that the cottage has not been lived in for years - and it isn't long before they have sensed a spooky presence. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix star in this festive special of the sitcom, with Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant. Festive edition from 2013.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Nathan Caton, Greg Davies and Micky Flanagan join host Dara O Briain and regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz. First aired in June 2012.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Grime artist and chef Big Zuu is off to Portsmouth to cook the perfect post-performance meal for comedian Rosie Jones, including fresh fish and chips just like her Nanna made.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Carl Donnelly, Jo Caulfield and Milton Jones join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from June 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former Labour home secretary Alan Johnson takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and journalist and political commentator Tim Shipman joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam leads the inquiry into a fire at a cinema, and finds that the last unidentified body bears an uncanny resemblance to a man murdered many years previously. Unfortunately, an interview with the gangster charged with the murder - played in a straight role by comedian Jack Dee - leaves her more confused than she was to begin with. Amanda Burton stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro returns to Sun Hill, where he resumes his role as Superintendent - and immediately asks Jo Masters to find out how the press obtained a photo of Lesley Palmer. Meanwhile, Smithy and Laura Bryant continue to investigate the real Gabriel Kent's identity - and try to fathom the true nature of his relationship with June Ackland.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team help a tax driver who has got his arm caught in a drain. Meanwhile, Pitbull appoints a reluctant Recall to represent him at his disciplinary hearing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita is devastated by what she has seen; Michelle has good news; Phil has a proposition for Frank; and when Nadia turns up again, Grant decides to take matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Snowdrifts cut off Arden House on the night before Hogmanay, forcing Janet and the doctors to face a long evening huddled in front of a roaring fire. As the hours drag on, tempers wear thin and a few old scores are settled before the crowing cock heralds the dawn. Festive special of the Highland medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen, Jessica Turner and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: District Nurse Peggy Snow's attempts to do a good deed result in a serious allegation from a grieving son. Drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire as sisters-in-law living in a small Yorkshire town..

credits.actor: Sarah Lancashire as sisters-in-law living in a small Yorkshire town

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An aristocrat who has fallen on difficult times seeks the roguish dealer's help in redeeming a valuable antique he has pawned. Light-hearted drama, guest starring Jack Shepherd, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Tinker lectures Lovejoy on the importance of not abusing his ability to gather ill-gotten gains. However, the antiques dealer briefly turns his back on his own ethical standards, only to soon regret his transgression. Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton star.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Despatched by Munro to kill a French colonel, Sharpe is wounded in battle and hovers at death's door - but Harper and a mute nun nurse him back to health. Once recovered, he sets out in search of vengeance with a newly forged sword. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean and Daragh O'Malley.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads find themselves in a tight spot after a job turns to disaster in Russia. Penniless and desperate to go home, they visit the British Embassy, where news filters through of a department that allows men to travel the world fixing up British Government property. Oz's criminal past comes back to haunt them and threatens to ruin their chances, but, thankfully, Neville has friends in high places who save the day.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads prepare to start work on the Ambassador's residence in Havana, but get off to a bad start with their new gaffer, who makes it clear he considers them a bunch of cowboys. Wyman catches the eye of a sultry local beauty during a night out, while Oz is captivated by the charms of the Cuban National Ballet's leading lady - and turns to Barry for advice on romance. Tim Healy, Noel Clark, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are invited to help create an Arabian-style garden in Malaga. Before long, a local resident is found dead, and a mysterious landowner is the chief suspect. When it transpires that someone has blocked the mountainside channels on which the new garden will rely for its supply of water, it appears the precious commodity may provide a motive for the killing. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to re-create a Victorian garden in Regent's Park, where they meet all manner of intriguing characters - but the oasis of calm in central London is shattered by the discovery of a body. The victim is a respected Harley Street psychiatrist - whose three-legged dog appears to hold the key to solving the case. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A bride-to-be and professional tennis player is found dead after her hen party, and the chief bridesmaid, best man and groom-to-be all come under the team's suspicion.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the murder of a B-movie director when the production of Demon Brides comes to Kembleford. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: The discovery of a concrete-encased body at a Docklands building site leads to conflict between DCI Hunt and the location's owner. Investigations are further hampered by the disappearance of crucial evidence, an incident that points to a mole in the detective's own team. Meanwhile, Alex discovers that her fascination with the case is distracting her from returning home.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene learns crooked cops are going to interrupt a bullion robbery and steal the gold for themselves - a discovery that gives him the chance to root out corruption in the force once and for all. Meanwhile, the arrival of an attractive woman highlights the cracks in his relationship with Alex, who is making him doubt her trustworthiness.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: First of a two-part story by Lynda La Plante in which the team investigate the death of a prostitute who plunged from the balcony of a block of luxury apartments. They discover she was the daughter of a famous Seventies TV star murdered 12 years previously, whose killer was never traced, and try to find a link between the two crimes. David Hayman stars as the newly promoted DCS Michael Walker, alongside Victoria Smurfit, Colin Salmon and Frances Barber.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Join Agent Danny from the Mission Employable Agency as he takes to the skies as a pilot.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is peeling off old wallpaper on Linda's walls, but he is actually destroying Fizz' hypnotic posters..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo finds himself shrunk and then dragged inside the President's head, along with Fizz. He thinks the hamster is a little, lost boy and decides to help him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is on a camping trip but he is actually just in the city park. He mistakes Weasel for a wounded bear and tries to help him..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds himself out on the street after his landlady orders him to leave. Near to tears, he is desperate for the comforts of home again, but fortunately a scarecrow and a pair of false teeth soon come to his rescue. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An old photo album causes Bean to reminisce about the happy holidays he spent at Scout camp as a boy - and prompts him to buy a tent in a bid to recapture his childhood.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben turns his attention to one upping Gwen at Space Camp.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Flustering Mindless Woe of the Flushable Memory Wipes
programme.desc: Animated comedy. A chocolate pudding incident forces George and Harold into hiding..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes Dave on an adventure camping, but Dave isn't sure it's a great idea. He's proved right when they both wake up in a bear's cave..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James shares more highlights from the series. He prepares prawn toast and ribs and offers advice on making butter at home. Plus, recipes from Nick Nairn, Clare Smyth and Lenny Carr Roberts and a chance to see James' food tour of Norfolk.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Monica Galetti for a culinary journey around Oxford, where they pay a visit to Raymond Blanc at his restaurant Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons, and sample some of his award-winning dishes. They take a trip up the river to a farm where they pick raspberries for a pudding, and James prepares a chicken dish with morels in the grounds of Raymond's restaurant.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Amman in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. He catches up with his old friend Maria who runs a cookery school, discovers how the country is becoming a serious wine-producing region and visits a bustling fruit and vegetable market for ingredients. Ainsley's dishes include chargrilled sumac lamb cutlets with tabbouleh and falafel with hummus.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Martin Clunes narrates more tips on how to keep dogs mentally stimulated during lockdown. Cameras follow Bodie, a Jack Russell that helps children with their reading, Summer, the golden retriever with maternal urges toward rescue kittens, and a dog that howls along to a 90s club hit.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Oswestry, North Shropshire, where members of the public are invited to bring in any antiques they own or have discovered to independent experts for valuation and more importantly, for sale.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1989 Liverpool v Arsenal Title Decider - ITV Football Classic
programme.desc: Elton Welsby presents extended highlights of the memorable match at Anfield, which saw Arsenal needing to win by at least two goals to pip their opponents to the title. With analysis from Bobby Robson, reports by Jim Rosenthal and commentary from Brian Moore and David Pleat.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the eliminator round of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Leeds to take part in a series of unusual challenges, with a prize of Â£1,000 up for grabs.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win Â£250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes, he challenges panellists Jimmy Carr, Carol Vorderman and Kriss Akabusi to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: The World Is Not Enough (1999)
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to protect the heiress of an oil dynasty after her father is killed in a bombing at MI6 headquarters. The attack is the work of an infamous terrorist who is unable to feel pain after surviving a gunshot to his head, and who now intends to destroy the world's supply of oil. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Robert Carlyle, Sophie Marceau and Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: Shake It Off: Ultimate Tens Party
programme.desc: Let's get this party started with some of the biggest party tracks from the Tens.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue to restore the Porsche 944 Turbo, using all their skills to overhaul the sports car.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton recreates a D-Day parachute jump in a genuine Second World War uniform.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr finally calls his father to offer his condolences for Helen's death, PJD begins a charity build for the March of Dimes and OCC finishes a bike for John Christner Trucking.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The masterminds behind the Soviet space programme, whose accomplishments range from the first satellite and the first ICBMs, to Mir, Buran and the ISS.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the tough task of working on board the Star of India, the world's oldest merchant ship, where his tasks include tarring the rigging and greasing the mast.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The team visits the birthplace of the Bugatti Veyron, and examines the car's inner workings.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew heads to the birthplace of the Morgan 3-Wheeler in England to examine the classic car's inner workings and exterior.

programme.title: Sharks and the City: New York
programme.desc: Biologist Craig O'Connell finds out whether the return of seals to the New York City harbour could also turn around the area's declining great white sharks numbers.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: Only four days remain before the Queen is due to visit to HMS Ocean, but the ship is still at sea. Meanwhile, Petty Officer Holmes loses his patience with his Guard of Honour.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China try to transform a Mini City 1000 to celebrate the car's 50th anniversary on a budget of Â£5,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. After buying a Mini City 1000 for Â£700, Mike Brewer plans to showcase the car at the three-day 50th birthday celebration of the vehicle in Birmingham. The only problem is that mechanic Edd China still has to complete the work necessary to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.sub-title: Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins work on a 1972 Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 bought for Â£2,200, stripping it down for a re-spray.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.sub-title: Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer visits Edd China to see how work is progressing on the 1972 Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000, and finds out how much its value has risen by.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for the Bond Bug, a three-wheeled 1970s British sports car, hoping that if he can acquire one his expert mechanic Edd China can make it roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV in the south of France. However, with age comes problems, and expert mechanic Edd China needs to strip it back to its bare bones to breathe new life into the vehicle, as almost every aspect of the quirky car requires attention.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take advantage of an iconic three wheeler, the Messerschmitt KR200, as it is about to celebrate its 60th birthday.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Mini Moke, which was designed as an off-road military vehicle, for expert mechanic Edd China to work on - before trying to sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australia's inhospitable Outback terrain.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: A violent summer storm sees the Young Guns race to save their only claim from a flood. Former trucker Chris arrives in Lightning Ridge, desperate to make a fortune in opal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare, rally-bred 1972 Lancia Fulvia. He and Ant must fix its bad CV joints, a broken heater, cracked dash and a debris-clogged fuel system.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he has encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Drew Pritchard visits a sprawling salvage yard that yields many unique items. Next, at an auction house, he faces off against other dealers in a bidding war.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steven Fletcher tackles an intricate Boulle-work clock that has not ticked for more than 15 years, and soft toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch take on a threadbare wheeled elephant. Woodwork specialist William Kirk gets to grips with one of the show's oldest assignments in the form of a 300-year-old Georgian desk that is showing its age.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part two of two. Henry Cole has the chance to visit some of the most scenic parts of the UK with stop-offs in the Lake District, the Pennines and the Cotswolds, finishing his ride at Land's End in Cornwall.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: A violent summer storm sees the Young Guns race to save their only claim from a flood. Former trucker Chris arrives in Lightning Ridge, desperate to make a fortune in opal.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: After racking up huge debts on the barren Romaso gold mine, Scott and George decide to dig elsewhere. But can they satisfy their investors that the new site will make a profit?.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of family man Richard Arenas, who was gunned down in broad daylight. With no apparent motive or witnesses, investigators tried to track down his killer on CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The abduction of Indiana woman Anita Woolridge from her Indiana home. Detectives suspected a man from her local health club and pressed on to find Anita before it was too late.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Assistant Chief investigator Charles Jantzen tries to save 70 cats and dogs from a run-down private animal rescue centre.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to understand what has happened to a shih tzu cross after it was found to be bleeding internally while being groomed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to save Jonti the cat, which has suffered a gaping neck wound after playing with the family dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A bride hopes for a stress-free big day, but trouble soon rears its head.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiny dog with a big growth on her leg. Colleague Tim attempts to get a world-famous crocodile out of the water to look at his injured foot.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: When Angela's family is unable to join her on her weight-loss journey, she reaches out to an old love, who is willing to make the trip to Texas with her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A mother is forced to change her own lifestyle as well as that of her 26-year-old son Sean, who weighs over 700lbs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Twenty nine-year-old twins Brandi and Kandi are close after a traumatic childhood, seeing food as a comfort. After weight-loss surgery, more challenges await the pair.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Petite bride Christine hopes to find a gown to match her 1920s-themed wedding, while Valentina returns for her fitting to add a personal touch to her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dorothy's friend Danielle has a surprise in store, while consultant Katie is delighted to turn customer for the day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Samantha wants a dress that shows off her tattoo, but her mother is not impressed. Meanwhile, singer Vanessa needs a 1930s-style dress for her jazz-inspired wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kristi is marrying a pro-baseball pitcher and needs a glamorous dress, while sports fan Jenna wants a gown that will impress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant girl Ashley wants a completely new look, although her family is not keen on the idea, while rodeo queen Becky wants to stand out.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa helps a woman to cope with her daughter's death. Larry Jr graduates from college, and his parents are keen that he move back into the family home.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: A surprise birthday party is planned for Theresa Caputo, but keeping it secret from a medium may not be the easiest thing to do.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo's schedule begins to fill up and she decides to venture out of her comfort zone and hire help. Meanwhile, a man copes with his brother's death.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: While Victoria is getting ready to attend her senior prom, her mother is unable to stop channelling spirits every step of the way.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Experts try to help Ronda, whose compulsive hoarding has driven away her children and left her feeling isolated, and Bennie, who cannot reach his bed or see his sofa beneath the piles of clutter he has accumulated.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: A case in which a 15-year-old girl relied on Facebook to stay in contact. When she agreed to meet one of the boys in person, she soon discovered the terrible truth behind her online friendship.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: The story of two University of New Mexico students who were abducted at knifepoint by a deranged predator. In the desert they faced a brutal fight for survival.

programme.title: Kid Criminals
programme.desc: In America at any one time there are more than 70,000 children behind bars, and this two-part documentary meets some of those in high-security prisons who have committed shocking crimes. The first programme explores Indiana's Pendleton Juvenile Correctional Facility, where a number of teenagers are serving time for sex offences, including 18-year-old William McConnell, who is being monitored for his predilection for grooming the younger boys in the prison, and has already been sent to Pendleton twice before.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three case studies showing the lengths to which investigators will go to catch the killers of people classed as missing and presumed dead.
